result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter A Waupoose

records.addlTxt: 9:49 AM Defendant Peter A Waupoose in court.  Attorney Megan McGee Norris appeared by video for Peter A Waupoose.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Norris and Waupoose have complaint and has filed a waiver of PH form to take care of that today as well. Waupoose agrees. Court does verbal waiver of PH colloquy, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Norris will proceed to ARGN with the understanding that it will mirror the complaint. State said it will mirror. Norris proceeds to ARGN, waives reading of an Information, enters NG to all counts. Court informs Norris of procedure for PTC/JT in Forest County, contact JA for JT. Court reviews file as it relates to the bond forfeiture that is also set for today. Norris asks Court to not forfeit bond for stated reasons. Court will set aside forfeiture of bond, sets bond at $1100.00 cash with same conditions.
From attorney to move time of hearing to 9:45 AM from 10:30 Am
on Request to Appear Remotely

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Peter A Waupoose
Current: 3738 S 20th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53221 United States  (Effective: 09-06-2022)
Prior: 3738 S 20th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53221 United States
Paid in full

10:10 AM Defendant Peter A Waupoose not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Peter Waupoose did appear via Zoom at his scheduled time but was not authorized to appear via Zoom, also had issues logging in, could not hear anything. State - did finally get Zoom working, State informed him that the Court was issuing a warrant due to his non-appearance in person. Court forfeits bond posted, issues bench warrant body or $600.00.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Order to Quash Warrant and to Reinstate Bond
Motion to Quash Warrant and To Reinstate Bond
Of Detainer
Clerk received a phone call indicating that the defendant has been in the Shawano County Jail for about 2 day, called at 11:00 AM.

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Peter A Waupoose not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. State  - set for AIA. Discussion on the bond and previously issued warrant, will again forfeit the $500.00 and issue a bench warrant, body or $750.00.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Peter A Waupoose
Current: 236 Andrew Street, Shawano, WI 54166 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 907 Smalley Street, Shawano, WI 54166
PAW - AIA 7/20/22 - Insufficient Address.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

11:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Peter A Waupoose in court. Court questions Waupoose why he was not in court this morning. Waupoose explains, bailed out last night and ride he had arranged for this morning fell through, on his way from Shawano and got a ride from stranger. State - based on appearance now, does not object to reinstating bond and cancelling warrant. Court reviews case, based on State, cancels warrant, reinstates bond and will proceed to INIT. Waupoose has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Waupoose understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Waupoose has contacted SPD and they are sill looking for an attorney to be appointed to his case. Court will have AIA set. Waupoose asks for signature bond. Court denies that request.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $500.00

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Peter A Waupoose not in court. State based on non-appearance, asks for forfeiture of bond posted and a warrant, body or $1000, returnable nationwide. Court so orders.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:00 am.
from defendant requesting paperwork needed to file a motion to dismiss.

Called 3:07 PM. Peter Waupoose appears by video, from FC jail. Charles Simono appears on behalf of the state. State no complaint filed, waiting on reports - major investigator has been extremely busy, asks for this to be held over until  next Tuesday and the bond to remain. Waupoose makes bond argument. State asks that the bond remain for reasons as stated on the record. Court will continue bond, confirms address. Waupoose makes statement, can afford $100. State would be willing to amend to $500 cash. Court will amend bond to $500 cash and adjourns to June 14, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
Cash set
